Spring bank holiday 2016: All libraries will be closed bank holiday Monday 30 May, opening as normal on Tue 31 May. Read more.

Home → New in and suggestions → Booked Out podcast

Booked Out podcast

Booked Out is our monthly book recommendation podcast, from Woodbridge Library’s Kellie Dimmock, Richard Baker, Sheila Haskins and Sophie Green.

<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/april-2016-classic-horror/">April 2016: Classic horror</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Apr 1, 2016</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Richard and guests discuss classic horror titles including <cite>Lost Hearts</cite> by M R James, Mary Shelley's <cite>Frankenstein</cite>, Edgar Allan Poe's <cite>The Tell-Tale Heart</cite> and <cite>The Golem</cite> by Gustav Meyrink.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/march-2016-local-authors-local-heroes/">March 2016: Local authors, local heroes</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Mar 1, 2016</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sheila and guests discuss their favourite local authors including Ruth Dugdall and Delia Smith and featuring special guest star, author Robin Herne.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/february-2016-under-the-radar/">February 2016: Under the radar</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Feb 1, 2016</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie and guests discuss recommended titles in international fiction including: <cite>Neverhome</cite> by Laird Hunt; <cite>A Heart so White</cite> by Javier Marias; <cite>Don't Let's Go to the Dogs Tonight</cite> by Alexandra Fuller; <cite>Novel 11, Book 18</cite> by Dag Solstad and <cite>Snow</cite> by Orhan Pamuk.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/january-2016-books-that-have-made-a-difference/">January 2016: Books that have made a difference</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jan 1, 2016</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie and guests discuss titles that have changed their lives including; <cite>Threads: the Delicate Life of John Craske</cite> by Julia Blackburn, <cite>No Surrender</cite> by Constance Maud, <cite>Nella Last's War: the second World War Diaries of housewife 49</cite> by Nella Last ,and <cite>The Little Grey Men</cite> by BB.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/december-2015-best-of-2015/">December 2015: Best of 2015</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Dec 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie and guests discuss the most borrowed titles of 2015 plus some recommendations from library staff and customers including <cite>The Girl on the Train</cite> by Paula Hawkins, <cite>Go Set a Watchman</cite> by Harper Lee, <cite>H is for Hawk</cite> by Helen Macdonald and <cite>Save with Jamie</cite> by Jamie Oliver.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/november-2015-judging-books-by-their-covers/">November 2015: Judging books by their covers</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Nov 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sheila and guests discuss how, why and whether or not we should be judging books by their covers. Titles discussed include <cite>Northanger Abbey</cite> by Val McDermid, <cite>The Betrayers</cite> by David Bezmozgis and <cite>Little Failure</cite> by Gary Shteyngart.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/october-2015-noir/">October 2015: Noir</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Oct 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie and guests discuss Noir in print, film and television titles available from Suffolk Libraries including <cite>Deep Water</cite> by Patricia Highsmith, <cite>The Spirit</cite> by Will Eisner, <cite>True Detective</cite>, <cite>Chinatown</cite>, <cite>L.A. Confidential</cite>, <cite>The Killing</cite>, <cite>The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo</cite> by Steig Larsson and Frank Miller's <cite>Sin City</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/september-2015-the-natural-world/">September 2015: The natural world</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Sep 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie and guests discuss best recommended Natural History books including <cite>Badgerlands</cite> by Patrick Barkham, <cite>Meadowland: the private life of an English field</cite> by John Lewis-Stempel, <cite>Wildlings: The Secret Garden of Eileen Soper</cite>, <cite>My First Summer in the Sierra</cite> by John Muir, <cite>Wild Places</cite> by Robert Macfarlane, <cite>Last Chance to See</cite> by Douglas Adams and Mark Carwardine, and <cite>Humble by Nature</cite> by Kate Humble.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/august-2015-best-of-childrens-fiction/">August 2015: Best of children's fiction</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Aug 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie and guests recommend children and YA fiction titles for all ages including <cite>Buffalo Soldier</cite> by Tanya Landman, <cite>Swallows and Amazons</cite> by Arthur Ransome, <cite>Wonder</cite> by R.J. Palacio, <cite>Looking for Alaska</cite> by John Green, picture books by Emma Chichester Clark and Rebecca Cobb, and series including Erin Hunter's <cite>Warrior Cats</cite>, <cite>Adventure Island</cite> by Helen Moss, <cite>iHorror (Pick your path)</cite> by Steve Barlow and Steve Skidmore, and the <cite>Naruto</cite> Manga by Masahai Kishimoto.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/july-2015-books-in-translation/">July 2015: Books in translation</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jul 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Richard and guests discuss recommended titles of translated fiction including <cite>Miss Smilla's Feeling for Snow</cite> by Peter Hoeg, <cite>The letter for the King</cite> by Tonke Dragt, <cite>Out Stealing Horses</cite> by Per Petterson, <cite>The Dead Lake</cite> by Hamid Ismailov, and <cite>The Ghost Rider</cite> by Ismail Kadare.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/june-2015-brave-new-reads/">June 2015: Brave New Reads</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jun 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss the six titles selected as Brave New Reads for 2015: <cite>The Dead Lake</cite> by Hamid Ismailov, <cite>Fallen Land</cite> by Patrick Flanery, <cite>Black Country</cite> by Liz Berry, <cite>Any Other Mouth</cite> by Anneliese Mackintosh, <cite>Badgerlands</cite> by Patrick Barkham and <cite>Prayers for the Stolen</cite> by Jennifer Clements.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/may-2015-cookery-books/">May 2015: Cookery books</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published May 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie and guests discuss their favourite cooks and cookery books including <cite>Sous Chef: 24 Hours in the Kitchen</cite> by Michael Gibney, <cite>Eat: The Little Book of Fast Food</cite> by Nigel Slater, Nigella Lawson's <cite>How to be a Domestic Goddess</cite> and James Martin's <cite>Great British Winter Cookbook</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/april-2015-lucky-dip/">April 2015: Lucky dip</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Apr 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">In this improvised 'Lucky Dip' edition, Sheila and guests review a random selection of titles and explore the art of judging books by their covers. Books discussed include <cite>Little Women</cite> by Louisa M Alcott, <cite>Fahrenheit 451</cite> by Ray Bradbury, <cite>The Little Old Lady who Struck Lucky Again</cite> by Catharina Ingelman-Sundberg, <cite>When I was a Nipper</cite> by Alan Titchmarsh and <cite>Kenneth Grahame: An Innocent in the Wild Wood</cite> by Alison Prince.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/march-2015-irish-writers/">March 2015: Irish writers</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Mar 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Irish Writers. In celebration of St. Patrick's Day, Sophie Green and guests discuss titles by Irish Writers available through Suffolk Libraries including <cite>Amongst Women</cite> by John McGahern, <cite>History of the Rain</cite> by Niall Williams, <cite>Nora Webster</cite> by Colm Toibin and <cite>The Butcher Boy</cite> by Patrick McCabe.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/february-2015-love-is-in-the-air/">February 2015: Love is in the air</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Feb 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Love is in the Air. Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Romance in titles available through Suffolk Libraries including <cite>North and South</cite> by Elizabeth Gaskell, <cite>Uncommon Arrangements</cite> by Katie Roiphe, <cite>Love Lessons</cite> by Joan Wynham, <cite>Vivien's Heavenly Ice Cream Shop</cite> by Abby Clements and <cite>Fifty Shades of Grey</cite> by E.L. James</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/january-2015-graphic-novels/">January 2015: Graphic novels</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jan 1, 2015</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Richard Baker and guests discuss Graphic Novels available through Suffolk Libraries including DC Comics, <cite>Minutemen/Silk Spectre</cite>, Alan Moore's <cite>V for Vendetta</cite> and <cite>Watchmen</cite> and <cite>Ordinary Victories</cite> by Manu Larcenet.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/december-2014-now-thats-what-i-call-the-best-of-2014/">December 2014: Now that’s what I call… the best of 2014</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Dec 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests round up the year with recommendations from library staff and customers including <cite>The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry</cite> by Rachel Joyce, <cite>The Miniaturist</cite> by Jessie Burton, Adam Fould’s <cite>In the Wolf’s Mouth</cite> and <cite>River Cottage Light and Easy – Healthy Recipes for Every Day</cite> by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, plus the films <cite>Gravity</cite> and <cite>Philomena</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/november-2014-the-best-of-the-box-sets/">November 2014: The best of the box sets</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Nov 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss <cite>The Killing</cite>, <cite>Mad Men</cite>, <cite>Game of Thrones</cite> and <cite>Our Zoo</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/october-2014-novellas-and-short-fiction/">October 2014: Novellas and short fiction</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Oct 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss <cite>The Testament of Mary</cite> by Colm Toibin, <cite>On Chesil Beach</cite> by Ian McEwan, <cite>Will Not Attend</cite> by Adam Resnick, <cite>Hotel du Lac</cite> by Anita Brookner and <cite>The End of the Affair</cite> by Graham Greene.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/september-2014-things-that-go-bump-in-the-night/">September 2014: Things that go bump in the night</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Sep 1, 2014</p>

<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/august-2014-the-fabulous-world-of-childrens-books/">August 2014: The fabulous world of children’s books</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Aug 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss <cite>The Fault in Our Stars</cite> by John Green, <cite>The Enemy</cite> series by Charlie Higson and <cite>The Enchanted Wood</cite> by Enid Blyton as well as the works of Oliver Jeffers, Marcus Sedgwick, Holly Webb and Patrick Ness.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/july-2014-non-fiction-and-its-rise-in-popularity/">July 2014: Non-fiction ands its rise in popularity</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jul 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss <cite>Travels in West Africa</cite> by Mary Kingsley, <cite>Coming Up Trumps – A Memoir</cite> by Jean Trumpington, <cite>Toast: The Story of a Boy’s Hunger</cite> by Nigel Slater and <cite>Jane Austen</cite> by Claire Tomalin.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/april-2014-time-slip/">April 2014: Time slip</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Apr 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss <cite>Atonement</cite> by Ian McEwan, <cite>Restless</cite> by William Boyd, <cite>The Vanishing Act of Esme Lennox</cite> by Maggie O’Farrell, <cite>The Return</cite> by Victoria Hislop, <cite>Ferney</cite> by James Long, <cite>The King of Shadows</cite> by Susan Cooper and <cite>Life after Life</cite> by Kate Atkinson.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/march-2014-the-great-detectives-in-literature-and-television/">March 2014: The great detectives in literature and television</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Mar 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Georges Simenon’s - Maigret, Margery Allingham’s Albert Campion, the iconic Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle and Vera by Anne Cleeves.</p>

</article>

<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/january-2014-one-step-beyond/">January 2014: One step beyond</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jan 1, 2014</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss <cite>The Time Machine</cite> by H.G. Wells, <cite>The Dispossessed</cite> by Ursula Le Guin, <cite>Cloud Atlas</cite> by David Mitchell and <cite>Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?</cite> by Philip K. Dick.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/december-2013-escapism/">December 2013: Escapism</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Dec 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss <cite>The Cellist of Sarajevo</cite> by Steven Galloway, <cite>The Knife of Never Letting Go</cite> by Patrick Ness, <cite>Instructions for a Heatwave</cite> by Maggie O’ Farrell and <cite>Walking back to Happiness</cite> by Lucy Dillion.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/november-2013-rom-com-in-film/">November 2013: Rom com in film</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Nov 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss <cite>Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind</cite>, <cite>Mrs. Doubtfire</cite>, <cite>Groundhog Day</cite> and the Road Movies of Bob Hope and Bing Crosby.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/october-2013-poetry/">October 2013: Poetry</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Oct 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sheila Haskins and guests discuss William Blake’s <cite>The Tyger</cite>, Roald Dahl’s <cite>Revolting Rhymes</cite>, and A.A. Milne’s <cite>Now we are Six</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/september-2013-book-club-special-edition/">September 2013: Book club special edition</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Sep 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green joins members of the Seckford Book Group for a discussion of Julian Barnes’ <cite>A Sense of an Ending</cite>.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/august-2013-creepy-house-summer-reading-challenge-special/">August 2013: Creepy house Summer Reading Challenge special</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Aug 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Sophie Green and guests discuss include <cite>Alfie the Werewolf</cite> by Paul van Loon, <cite>The Thing</cite> by Chris Powling, <cite>Charlie and the Chocolate Factory</cite> by Roald Dahl, Jacqueline Wilson and the Harry Potter series, as well as sharing recommendations for reluctant readers.</p>

</article>



<article class="pb4 pb5-ns pt1 bt b--light-gray">

    <header class="pb2">

        <h1 class="f4 ma0 pa0 pb1"><a href="/new-suggestions/booked-out/july-2013-young-adult-fiction/">July 2013: Young adult fiction</a></h1>

        <p class="f6 f5-ns ma0 mb1 gray ">Written by <span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">the Booked Out team</span></span> &middot; Published Jul 1, 2013</p>

    </header>

    <p class="ma0">Kellie Dimmock and guests recommend teen fiction for readers of all ages. We also review this year's Carnegie Medal short list and the winner, Sally Gardner’s <cite>Maggot Moon</cite>.</p>

</article>
